node.title: Substitute Teacher 'Relieved of Duty' After Singing Britney Spears in Class
node.alt: A substitute teacher in Austin, Texas, was "relieved of his duty" on Friday after he was filmed singing "Toxic" by Britney Spears in the classroom. Here, Spears is seen performing in Rotterdam, Netherlands, during her "The Onyx Hotel Tour" in 2004.
node.description: The teacher was reportedly sent home for failing to follow the school's "best practices" after performing Spears' pop hit "Toxic."
node.content:
["A substitute teacher in Austin, Texas, was reportedly \"relieved of his duty\" on Friday after he was filmed doing a performance of the song \"Toxic\" by Britney Spears.", "A video obtained by local news station KXAN-TV showed the substitute teacher belting out the famous pop song at Bowie High School using a karaoke machine and disco lights.", "The teacher was sent to the school to cover a shift on Friday and was asked to leave after the incident occurred during a first-period class. A spokesperson for Austin Independent School District (AISD) said the teacher was \"relieved of his duty\" for failing to follow the school's \"best practices,\" according to KXAN.", "\"I've heard worse Britney Spears covers, but the lights are a bit much,\" the spokesperson said sarcastically. \"All processes were followed, it was simply a case of a substitute not following our practices.\"", "", "
A substitute teacher in Austin, Texas, was \"relieved of his duty\" on Friday after he was filmed singing \"Toxic\" by Britney Spears in the classroom. Here, Spears is seen performing in Rotterdam, Netherlands, during her \"The Onyx Hotel Tour\" in 2004.
", "The substitute teacher was not identified by name in local media reports and has not responded to requests for comment. However, the teacher was able to pick up another position at a different Austin high school after the incident, according to KXAN. It is unclear what initially prompted the classroom performance.", "The teacher's performance occurred as Spears continues to grab headlines following her recent dissolution of a controversial conservatorship. Last month, a California judge ruled that Spears's conservatorship would be terminated, allowing the 39-year-old pop icon to be freed from an arrangement that had seen her personal and financial decisions overseen by others for 13 years.", "Spears was first placed under the arrangement in 2008 amid concerns about her mental health and ability to manage her own personal and professional responsibilities. In California, the state defines a conservatorship as a legal arrangement wherein \"a responsible person or organization\" is appointed by a judge to \"to care for another adult\" when it is determined that adult \"cannot care for himself or herself or manage his or her own finances.\"", "Spears's case received widespread attention from fans and other celebrities for years, with supporters using the slogan #FreeBritney to bring further traction to the issue. The pop singer called the end of her conservatorship \"the best day ever,\" writing on social media after the decision: \"Good God I love my fans so much it's crazy!!!\"", "Spears has since said that she requires \"lots of healing\" and is on the \"right medication,\" amid her newfound freedom."]
